qas.question: Which President made their stance on affirmative action clear in 1995?
How long after his inauguration was Bill Clinton's speech?
Which speech did Bill Clinton's speech draw parallels to?

answers.text: President Lyndon B. Johnson's "Freedom is not Enough"

qas.question: What did President Clinton claim would not be enough to give everyone in American equality?
What was President Clinton's response to the claim that affirmative action was hurting the white middle class.

answers.text: the policy was not the source of their problems

qas.question: Which President made their stance on non-affirmative action clear in 1995?
How soon after his inauguration was Bill Clinton's speech?

plausible_answers.text: Lyndon B. Johnson's "Freedom is not Enough"

qas.question: Which speech did Bill Clinton's speech draw differences from?
What did President Clinton claim would be enough to give everyone in American equality?

plausible_answers.text: policy was not the source of their problems
